subject: Not Dead Yet
event:
While it is strangely moving to realize that so many people around the world care so deeply about my life and death, I have to go with Mark Twain and insist that the rumors of my death have been greatly exaggerated.

It was Sir George Martin, of Beatles fame, who has passed away.  Not me.

He will be missed.  I never met Sir George (I did meet Paul McCartney once, for about a minute, while waiting for the valet to bring my rental car up at the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills), but like many millions of others, I loved the Beatles, and Martin's contribution to their music is worthy of recognition and honor.

In his memory:
<lj-embed id="697"/>

As for me, I am still here, still writing, still editing, still going to movies and reading books, and I expect to hang around for quite a while yet, thank you very much.

But thank you all for caring.

comments.article: I did have to do a double take when I saw the news. Alas, all is well with you. See you at Balticon!

<<
[Error: Irreparable invalid markup ('<i [...] news.>') in entry. Owner must fix manually. Raw contents below.]

<<<I did have to do a double take when I saw the news.>>> Likewise (blushes).
Please tell us what meeting Paul McCartney was like!
comments.subject: Sir Paul

comments.article: It blew me away.  I am afraid I got completely tongue-tied and acted like a moron.
comments.subject: Re: Sir Paul

comments.article: I did receive a series of frantic texts from a friend about this. I hadn't read about it yet but assured him that "It has to be a hoax or something. I'm from the future and Mr. George RR Martin is alive and well and has already published two non-ASOIAF novels... but we've been waiting two whole years for the third. Lots of 'write faster George' from the New Baby Boomers."
comments.subject: RIP the other George Martin

comments.article: Don't forget to take your vitamins and drink plenty of water in order to prolong your life George ;)
comments.subject: Dewi

comments.article: Or, you know, eat what you want, drink what you want, live your life for you - not us. It's all good GRRM.
comments.subject: Re: Dewi

comments.article: Valar dohaeris

... the hashtag on Twitter also scared me for a second. I then asked google and well, saying that I was relieved is pretty mean, but well... since you are one of my heros (yes, you really are - for many reasons)...
Anyways, rest in peace, Sir George Martin.
And, dear George R.R. Martin: I hope that you'll still live many many MANY healthy years!!! <3
comments.subject: To be honest with you...

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: horns
comments.article: It has been a surreal day here -- can't even imagine how it's been at Terrapin Station!
Verily, may thou continue crafting thy tales of woe and hope, eclair and despair.
comments.subject: Thou art alive!

comments.article: I actually laughed when I saw the title and the first few sentences of this post on Facebook. I didn't think the post would turn so melancholy. RIP other George Martin.

It was a good decision to ignore social media today then, and read all day :)

R.I.P. Sir George Martin

George,

In the last few days, how many goof balls have pointed at you and screamed "WHITE WALKER!" when encountering you on the street?
comments.subject: Reports of your death being highly exagerated

comments.article: Very glad to hear that you are still with us. I am also sad to hear of the loss Sir George. Enjoy your movies, have a great day!

Big sigh of relief :-) I thought I was seeing things - until they mentioned the Beatles :-))))

We in Russia say that mixes-up like these guarantee one a long and happy life.
How hard is it to write 'Sir' instead of 'Ser'?
comments.subject: Sir

comments.article: Mate.... Check yourself
comments.subject: RE: Sir

comments.article: Very glad to hear it.

Hi George,

When I read that I felt OMG. Then again read the name and felt thank God its not our George.

You should live long to enjoy the life you deserve and to write many books for us. I should live long to read those books.Its my wish.

Sometimes I feel sad that some of ASOIAF readers might have died without reading all books of the series. RIP those souls.
comments.subject: Long Live

comments.article: Fractionally disappointed that you didn't elect for "Not Yet Dead" as the title to this entry, but nevertheless happy to know you're well.
comments.subject: Title

comments.article: You mean I trekked all this way through a warzone to save the life of George Francis Martin, and you're not really him?!
comments.subject: George Francis Martin

comments.article: Maybe you should get Granny Weatherwax's "I Atn't Dead" placecard :) But seriously,I would not survive another favourite writer's death.
I remember the 70s, when there were George Martins in all my favorite things: you, the Beatles guy, and the Giants' defensive end.

Glad you are still with us. I'm old enough to remember who the late George Martin was (and a Beatles fan to boot). In a world where Paul McCartney is turned away from a VIP line because the person checking in the guests didn't know who he was I'm not surprised there was confusion. You are currently a known figure.

I'm just a few years younger than you are. It gets to where I check the Obits every day to see if I'm in there (helps me plan my day). I say we should fool them all and live to be old enough to be forgotten before the obit gets written!

Slante,
Kathleen
No offense, didn't even think of you until this! But then...I named my kid Strawberry Fields so I'm a bit biased. <3 Glad you're okay too though so sad to lose George!

"I think I'll go for a walk!"

"You're not fooling anyone, you know."

Glad to know you're still alright, and I'm sad that Sir George Martin is gone.

With that said, there's a certain irony to people trying to bump you off. We're used to *you* offing much-admired figures!
comments.subject: Irony
